definitions.definition: The result of launching a projectile or bullet .
examples: The shot was wide of the mark.

definitions.definition: ( sports ) The act of launching a ball or similar object toward a goal.
examples: They took the lead on a last-minute shot .

definitions.definition: ( countable , athletics ) The heavy iron ball used for the shot put .
examples: The shot flew twenty metres, and nearly landed on the judge's foot.

definitions.definition: ( uncountable , athletics ) The athletics event of shot put .
( uncountable ) Small metal balls , or other hard objects of various shapes , used as ammunition , especially in shotgun shells or artillery shells.
examples: Steel shot , unlike lead shot , avoids contaminating the land with spent lead.
The bank robbers' handloaded shotgun shells used rock salt as the shot .

definitions.definition: ( uncountable , military , historical ) Metal or stone balls (or similar), not necessarily small, used as ammunition .
examples: The shot for this ship's deck guns, in that day, consisted only of solid iron balls such as ten-pounders.

definitions.definition: Someone who shoots (a gun, longbow, etc.); a person reckoned as to their aim.
examples: He'd make a bad soldier, since he's a lousy shot .

definitions.definition: ( figurative ) An opportunity or attempt .
examples: I'd like just one more shot at winning this game.

definitions.definition: A remark or comment , especially one which is critical or insulting .
( slang , sports , US ) A punch or other physical blow.

A measure of alcohol , usually spirits , as taken either from a shot-glass or directly from the bottle , equivalent to about 44 milliliters or 1.5 ounces . ("pony shot"= 30 milliliters; 1 fluid ounce)
examples: I'd like a shot of whisky in my coffee.

definitions.definition: A single serving of espresso .
( archaic ) A reckoning , a share of a tavern bill , etc.
( photography , film ) A single snapshot or an unbroken sequence of photographic film exposures , or the digital equivalent; an unedited sequence of frames .
examples: We got a good shot of the hummingbirds mating.

definitions.definition: ( US , Canada , Australia , medicine ) A vaccination or injection .
examples: I went to the doctor to get a shot for malaria.

definitions.definition: ( baseball , informal ) A home run that scores one, two, or three runs (a four run home run is usually referred to as a grand slam ).
examples: His solo shot in the seventh inning ended up winning the game.

definitions.definition: ( US federal prison system ) Written documentation of a behavior infraction.
( fisheries ) A cast of one or more nets .
( fisheries ) A place or spot for setting nets.
( fisheries ) A single draft or catch of fish made.

definitions.definition: A charge to be paid , a scot or shout .

main_definition: A charge to be paid , a scot or shout .
